metadata.title: CVE-2024-7006 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in Libtiff via `tif_dirinfo.c`.This issue may allow an attacker to trigger memory allocation failuresthrough certain means, such as restricting the heap space size or injectingfaults, causing a segmentation fault. This can cause an application crash,eventually leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-7006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm14
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm14
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm14
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm14').
gdal package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
